info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 12:49PM CDT until September 24 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, in south central Arkansas, Union. In southwest Arkansas, Columbia and Lafayette.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. While rainfall amounts have been light over the last few hours, between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across the advisory area earlier this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to isolated 2 inches are expected over the area through mid afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Should the heavy rain areas expand or intensify, a Flash Flood Warning will be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Magnolia, Smackover, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, Norphlet, Junction City, McNeil, Bradley, Taylor, Calion, Emerson, Buckner, Village, Atlanta, Mount Holly, Macedonia, Lisbon and Smithland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Columbia, AR; Lafayette, AR; Union, AR
